channel.title: Posts on Internet of Me
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Internet of Me

item.title: IoT Dashboard | How To Physically Interface with the Connected World
item.description: Call me old fashioned, but I find the pressing of a button to initiate a flurry of web requests and API calls along wireless interfaces, filling websockets or flying down an HTTP streams, possess some ephemeral quality that is immeasurably more satisfying than automated predictive measures taken assure our constant consumption carries on with a negligible amount of consideration, contemplation and consideration; thus pruning away at the self’s essential prerogative to preserve and maintain.

item.title: Jupyter Notebook Basics
item.description: Some notes to keep handy as a reminder of the basics in using a Jupyter notebook What is a Jupyter notebook? According to the Web App’s main page: The Jupyter Notebook is an open-source web application that allows you to create and share documents that contain live code, equations, visualizations and explanatory text. Uses include: data cleaning and transformation, numerical simulation, statistical modeling, machine learning and much more. In my own words: Application for creating and sharing documents that contain:

item.title: Wharton Operations Analytics Notes
item.description: Operations Analytics Notes for Week 1: The descriptive analytics covered this week will provide a strong conceptual basis for predictive and prescriptive analytics in the following three weeks of the course. Covered by this Courser The class will start by going over a number of the most important and familiar problems in operations. The Newsvendor Problem is one of the fundamental problems in operations. We will also cover a range of related problems such as Resource Allocation, Network Management and Capacity Planning.

item.title: How to Create a Custom Email Signature for Mail
item.description: Personal email signatures are a great way to add a personal touch. Many know of and how to already do this in their email client of choice. Mail in OS X has some great options for customizing your personal signature and even allows for the creation of multiple and the formatting of the text and content. In an effort to add some creative and technical merit to my signature I have created a custom HTML signature.

item.title: Cat Photo App
Customizing the homepage with widgets
item.description: Homepage widgets display as sections on the homepage. They can be enabled/disabled and configured as desired. Academic has the following widgets available to use: About/biography Selected ideas Recent ideas Recent news/blog posts Projects Selected experiences Recent experiences Contact Tag cloud Custom widget (demonstrated with the teaching example) The example site that you copied to create your site uses all the different types of widget (except experiences), so you can generally just delete the widgets you don’t need and customize the parameters of the widgets you wish to keep.
